channel.title: The Best Compiler (The one I use, Always Works)
channel.description:
[b]This is a Compiler I used for My Client/Server and It works all the time. Those Perfect Compilers or Whatever you Noobs call it, Is really not that Perfect and don't think that if your Compiler is only like 7 Lines it sucks, Well it doesn't. To tell you the truth, The Perfect Compilers suck more, They have like 50 Lines of shit and This one I use is only 7 Lines and it works the same, If not better ;D[/b]
[b]Here it is-[/b]
@echo off[b](Keep this)[/b] cls[b](Keep this)[/b] title Pridescape Compiler [b](Change it to the Name of your Server or Client)[/b] echo Its Compiling,W8 N00b[b](When you Run it will say whatever you put here, But don't Erase the echo)[/b] "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java[b](Keep this)[/b] echo Finished Compiling.[b](Keep this)[/b] pause[b](Keep this)[/b]
[b]You have to Download Java JDK 6u7 on the Link Here[/b]- http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
Thanks, Pride.

item.title: The Best Compiler (The one I use, Always Works)
item.dc:creator: @Ii_H4v3_Pr1d3 Ii H4v3 Pr1d3
item.description:
@Ii_H4v3_Pr1d3 wrote:

This is a Compiler I used for My Client/Server and It works all the time. Those Perfect Compilers or Whatever you Noobs call it, Is really not that Perfect and don’t think that if your Compiler is only like 7 Lines it sucks, Well it doesn’t. To tell you the truth, The Perfect Compilers suck more, They have like 50 Lines of shit and This one I use is only 7 Lines and it works the same, If not better ;D

Here it is-

@echo off(Keep this)
cls(Keep this)
title Pridescape Compiler (Change it to the Name of your Server or Client)
echo Its Compiling,W8 N00b(When you Run it will say whatever you put here, But don’t Erase the echo)
“%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java(Keep this)
echo Finished Compiling.(Keep this)
pause(Keep this)

You have to Download Java JDK 6u7 on the Link Here- http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp

Thanks,
Pride.

Read full topic
item.source: The Best Compiler (The one I use, Always Works)
